amendment.description: Amendment limits the appropriation of economic support funds to Turkey until the Turkish government acknowledges the Armenian genocide and takes steps to honor the memory of its victims.
amendment.purpose: An amendment printed as amendment No. 67 in the Congressional Record of June 4, 1996, to limit to $22 million the amount of funds to be appropriated to Turkey under the Economic Support Fund until such time as that country acknowledges the atrocity committed against the Armenian population by the Ottoman Empire from 1915 to 1923.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Radanovich amendment (A019) Agreed to by recorded vote: 268 - 153 (Roll no. 217).
